org.usfirst.frc.team871.tools

Class EnhancedXBoxController

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.GenericHID
      • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.JoystickBase
        • edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick
          • org.usfirst.frc.team871.tools.EnhancedXBoxController

  • public class EnhancedXBoxController
extends edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Joystick
    An extension of Joystick taylored to the Xbox 360 controller which provides additional functionality including individual axis deadbanding, mapped deadbands, and button type emulation for all buttons.
    Author:
    Jack Langhorn
    See Also:
    XBoxAxes, XBoxButtons, XBoxJoypads, ButtonTypes

    • Method Detail

        Parameters:

        mode - The new ButtonTypes type

      • setAxisDeadband

        public void setAxisDeadband(XBoxAxes axis,
                            double dead)
        Sets the deadband of the corresponding button
        Parameters:
        axis - The affected axis
        dead - Double containing the new deadband value. Must be greater than 0 and less than 1.

      • getValue

        public boolean getValue(XBoxButtons button)
        Returns the value of the specified button. All buttons are active high, and there is no way to change this. This method respects the emulated type of the buttons.
        Parameters:
        button - The button whose value should be read
        Returns:
        Boolean containing the state of the button
        See Also:
        ButtonTypes

      • getValue

        public double getValue(XBoxAxes axis)
        Reads the value of the specified axis after deadbanding. The deadbanded values are linearly mapped to new values such that at the deadband, the value is 0, but at full power the value is 1. This prevents jerky readings when the raw value hovers around the deadband.

        If Trigger is read, the value returned will be the result from subtracting the value of the left trigger from the right trigger. This emulates both triggers affecting the same axis.

        Parameters:
        axis - The axis to read
        Returns:
        Double containing the value of the axis.

      • getValue

        public int getValue(XBoxJoypads pad)
        Reads the value of the specified joypad.
        Parameters:
        pad - The joypad to read
        Returns:
        Int containing the angle of the angle of the joypad. It will be a multiple of 45 degrees representing the position that was pressed. -1 will be returned if nothing was pressed.

      • getRawValue

        public boolean getRawValue(XBoxButtons button)
        Reads the raw value of the specified button. This method does not respect emulated types.
        Parameters:
        button - The button to read
        Returns:
        Boolean containing the value of the button

      • getRawValue

        public double getRawValue(XBoxAxes axis)
        Reads the raw value of the specified axis. This method does not deadband values.
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis to read
        Returns:
        Double between 0 and 1 containing the value of the axis

      • getDebouncedButton

        public boolean getDebouncedButton(XBoxButtons button)
        Reads and debounces the specified button. When read with this method, the button will read high only on the rising edge, regardless of the emulated type of the button.
        Parameters:
        button - The button to read
        Returns:
        Boolean containing the debounced value of the button
